message_1: Given that sin(x) = 0.5, find the value of x in radians using inverse trigonometric functions.
message_2:
To find the value of x in radians using inverse trigonometric functions, we can use the arcsin (also written as sin^(-1)) function. 

sin^(-1)(sin(x)) = sin^(-1)(0.5)

x = sin^(-1)(0.5)

There are two possible values for x in the range of 0 to 2π:

x = π/6 (or 30°) and x = 5π/6 (or 150°)

So, the values of x in radians are π/6 and 5π/6.
